name: F Movies Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: A high school senior decides to take the day off school and spend it with his girlfriend and best friend in which 1986 movie?
questions.explanation:
Ferris Bueller's Day Off.

	The school principal, Ed Rooney (Jeffrey Jones), sets out to prove that Ferris Bueller (Matthew Broderick) is not actually sick after he takes his ninth sick day for the year.  Ferris is just out for a day of fun with his unwilling and neurotic best friend, Cameron Fry (Alan Ruck), and  his beautiful girlfriend Sloane (Mia Sara) along for the ride. At the time this movie was made, Matthew Broderick was dating Jennifer Grey, who plays his sister Jeanne.

questions.text: In which 2003 movie does a timid father search for his missing son with the assistance of his new friend Dory?
questions.explanation:
Finding Nemo.

	Despite his father's warnings, Nemo (voiced by Alexander Gould), a young clownfish, ventures into the open sea and is taken by a scuba diver.  His father, Marlin (voiced by Albert Brooks), heads to Sydney Harbour in an attempt to find him.  Marlin is befriended along the way by a regal tang named Dory (voiced by Ellen DeGeneres), and must brave sharks, jellyfish and turtles to get to his son. Albert Brooks was born Albert Einstein, and he is brother to Bob Einstein who is well known for his character "Super Dave" Osbourne.

questions.text: A simple man sits at a bus stop and tells his life story to various strangers in which 1994 movie?
questions.explanation:
Forrest Gump.

	The story of Forrest Gump (Tom Hanks) who, while he was involved in some of the most historic moments in time, is always motivated by his love for Jenny Curran (Robin Wright Penn). Robin Wright Penn's son, Hopper Jack, is named after Dennis Hopper and Jack Nicholson.

questions.text: In which 1984 movie does Ren McCormack move to a small town where dancing is banned?
questions.explanation:
Footloose.

	With the help of the reverend's rebellious daughter Ariel (Lori Singer), Ren McCormack (Kevin Bacon) battles the local townspeople for the right to hold a senior prom with dancing and music. Kevin Bacon used the success of the trivia game titled "Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon" to set up the charitable social networking website sixdegrees.org, which links charities and people to one another.

questions.text: Kate must overcome her fear of flying to follow her fiance to Paris, after he breaks off their engagement in which movie from 1995?
questions.explanation:
French Kiss.

	Determined to get her fiance back, Kate (Meg Ryan) boards a plane to Paris.  Unbeknownst to her, fellow passenger, Luc (Kevin Kline), has hidden a stolen necklace and a grapevine in her bags to get them through customs.  So begins a journey through France, with Kate chasing her fiance Charlie (Timothy Hutton), and Luc chasing Kate to get his contraband back. Meg Ryan was raised a Roman Catholic, and her birth name was Margaret Mary Emily Hyra.

questions.text: In which 1990 film do a group of medical students experiment with near-death experiences?
questions.explanation:
Flatliners.

	Five medical students each have a reason to discover if there really is life after death.  They enter into an agreement to become clinically dead and then be revived by the others.  What they didn't count on was that their pasts would come back to haunt them. The five medical students were played by box-office heavyweights, Kiefer Sutherland (Nelson), Julia Roberts (Rachel Mannus), Kevin Bacon (David Labraccio), William Baldwin (Joe Hurley), and Oliver Platt (Randy Steckle).

questions.text: Two fugitives and their hostages, the Fuller family, must fight for their lives after they end up in a vampire bar in which 1996 Quentin Tarantino movie?
questions.explanation:
From Dusk Till Dawn.

	Two violent brothers, Seth (George Clooney) and Richard (Quentin Tarantino) Gecko, are on the run from the law and heading for a rendezvous in Mexico.  In order to get over the border, they kidnap ex-preacher Jacob Fuller (Harvey Keitel) and his two children.  Once over the border, and in a bar, the five are faced with new horrors when they discover the bar is full of vampires. Quentin Tarantino is reported to have an IQ of 160, on a par with Albert Einstein, Stephen Hawking, Thomas Jefferson and Bill Gates.

questions.text: In which movie from 2000 does a teenager have a vision of a plane crash, causing him and several classmates to get off the plane, only to discover that death is not finished with them?
questions.explanation:
Final Destination.

	When the plane that Alex Browning (Devon Sawa) and his friends were meant to be on explodes after take off, they think they have had a lucky escape.  The FBI however, are suspicious that Alex may have had something to do with the explosion.  The fact that the survivors are mysteriously being killed off one by one only convinces them further. The success of this film led to two further "Final Destination" movies.  "Final Destination 2" contains one of the greatest car crash scenes ever filmed and many inventive death scenes.  Unfortunately it also led to "Final Destination 3". The less said about this movie the better.

questions.text: Charles and Carrie end up happily unmarried in which 1994 movie starring Hugh Grant and Andie MacDowell?
questions.explanation:
Four Weddings and a Funeral.

	Charles (Hugh Grant) and a group of his friends attend weddings and one very tear-jerking funeral, while dealing with their love lives which don't always run smoothly. As a child, Hugh Grant was taught piano by Andrew Lloyd Webber's mother.

questions.text: In which 1999 movie does Edward Norton play an unnamed insomniac who attends support groups for diseases he doesn't have?
questions.explanation:
Fight Club.

	The narrator (Edward Norton) finds that attending support groups eases his insomnia.  However after he notices Marla Singer (Helena Bonham Carter), another impostor attending the groups, he is again unable to sleep.  After a chance meeting with Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt) his behaviour becomes more disturbing and erratic. Richmond Arquette, who played an intern in "Fight Club", is a sibling of David, Patricia, Rosanna and Alexis (born Robert) Arquette, all of whom are actors.
